newsitem.title: USA: hld Blyth Holdings sees Q4 loss.
newsitem.headline: hld Blyth Holdings sees Q4 loss.

text.p: Blyth Holdings Inc said Tuesday it expects to report a small decrease in sales and a considerably higher loss for the fourth quarter ended March 31, 1997, compared to the third quarter.
In the third quarter Blyth had revenues of $2.4 million for a net loss of $1.4 million or $0.12 a share.

The company said in a statement the loss in the quarter reflects premiums paid on the redemption of 8 percent convertible debentures due June 3, 1997, combined with a projected small decrease in sales, increased investment in marketing and sales, and one-time costs in connection with the recent restructuring of its executive team.

Blyth has redeemed $1 million in face value debentures at a cost of $1.4 million since the debentures were issued. The premium related to fourth quarter redemptions of convertible debentures will result in a one-time cost of more than $300,000.
The company expects to announce results in mid-May.
